GameData.LocalizedText:
Z46
Z46, a Type 1936C Destroyer that was scrapped before it was completed, you look forward to the day when everyone will no longer call you Z46. In your quest to find your name, the world is a different place than you expected, and the things you can't truly know without experiencing them are as awe-inspiring as the stars in the sky. Go forth and encounter the unknown, Z46, and we look forward to the day you find your name.
Being able to be touched is proof of one’s existence.
Z46 loves literature, and she is a symbol of the Iron Blood's cultural prowess.
Using Z46 As the leader of the Iron Blood, it is imperative that the Wiblingen Monastery Library be built as soon as possible. The Wiblingen Monastery Library has the [ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] Great Works of Writing slots, which allows Great Persons to create Great Works. The Name pursuit, unlocked with the Wiblingen Monastery Library, will ensure that the Z46 has enough [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writers. With a large number of [ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] Great Works of Writing, Z46 will reap the rewards of these masterpieces. By compactly building districts and recruiting Great Person to create Great Works, Z46 will easily win the Culture Victory.
Z46 was the first ship of the 1936C class of the German Nazi Navy, in fact only Z46 and Z47 of this class of destroyers had construction started. Both were bombed by Allied planes on the way to construction and were eventually scrapped.
The Girl Pursuing Name
Likes civilizations with high [ICON_Culture] Culture and hates civilizations with low [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Z46 likes civilizations with high Culture
(You have a high Culture)
Z46 hates civilizations with low Culture
(Your Culture is low)
(Your Culture is low)
What Once Was Her World
[ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] Great Works of Writing +4 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and 3x [ICON_Tourism] Tourism. All districts +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture value for each adjacent district. When your civilization creates Great Works, all districts of the city in which it is located will have a +20% [ICON_Culture] Culture adjacency bonus. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all military units in combat with Heavy Cavalry. Gain the Type 1936C Destroyer unique unit when the Combined Arms technology is researched.
[ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] Great Works of Writing +4 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Buildings and wonders are automatically themed when they have all their slots filled. All districts +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture value for each adjacent district. When your civilization creates Great Works, all districts of the city in which it is located will have a +20% [ICON_Culture] Culture adjacency bonus. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all military units in combat with Heavy Cavalry. Gain the Type 1936C Destroyer unique unit when the Combined Arms technology is researched.
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from each adjacent district tile.
Name pursuit
Name pursuit
Provides [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for 20% of the current city's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production each turn. Awards [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writers, [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artists and [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musicians points once finished, and grants a free [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writers.
Type 1936C Destroyer
Z46's unique Atomic era naval unit that replaces the Destroyer. Has powerful air defense and can carry out a range of 1 long range attack. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each air unit killed. Reveals Naval Raiders within sight range.
The Type 1936C, although an improvement on the Type 1936A and B, differed considerably from its predecessors. Experience gained through the war had shown that the anti-aircraft firepower of the destroyer was very important, and that small-caliber anti-aircraft weapons were very difficult to use against large aircraft protected by armor. On the other hand, the 150mm guns mounted on the 1936A were too heavy to be used on a destroyer, so the 1936C was prepared to use three new twin 128mm/45 SKC41 anti-aircraft guns as the main armament, which could be used against both the sea and the air, as well as the radar firing commanders that were the first for German destroyers, mounted at the rear. Due to the weight of the twin turrets, the turret arrangement was 1 forward and 2 aft in order to avoid the problem of burying the bow in the wind and waves with the overweight bow of the Type 1936A.
Five Type C destroyers were originally planned for 1936, numbered Z46-Z50, of which Z46 and Z47 were started in October 1941 at Bremen's Hidmark shipyard, but construction was halted in 1942, and then again in 1943, when progress was slow due to material shortages and bombing by Allied planes, and was finally abandoned in November 1944.Z48-Z50's The order to build Z48-Z50 was issued in June 1942, but actual work never began.
Piercing Shells provides +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting Heavy Cavalry
+{1_num} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength, Piercing Shells
+{1_num} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting Heavy Cavalry
Gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each air unit killed
+{Property} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength comes from air units killed
1936C
Iron Wing Annihilation
Killing air units provides +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
+{1_num} [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength comes from air units killed.
